text: Bright golden blonde with a foamy head. Aroma is light hay, smells tart, slightly soapy and slight herbal. Very light sour, juniper, earthy ad finishes very dry. Great!
Thanks, Treebs! Dry, floral, some botanicals. Touch of acidity. Great combination of flavors without going too far in any one direction.

My Bottom Line:
White grapes, citrus fruit and flowers move into tartness and light funk for a very pleasant Saison-like experience.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam covers the cloudy blond.
-Mouthfeel is appropriately effervescent.
-Drinkability is quite high if you are used to funk.
-Flavor clarity could be enhanced.

Bottle.
750 ml bottle from Jeremy. Very active bottle, but decent pour after it settled down. Mildly tart, but nice savory Saison body.

750ml bottle gusher after it stopped pours out cloudy bright golden topped with a white head. Nose is great citrus stone fruit bread malts spice and bubblegum. Taste is more of the fruit notes bread malt nice yeast notes and a little tartness.

From notes. Enjoyed this at a tasting at Andrews house for my first tasting with the Ann Arbor crew on July 8! 750 mL bottle. The pour is a foggy golden yellow color with a thick white head and some good lace as it falls. The lace is excellent. The aroma is lightly tart and vinous with some floral spices and a decent funkiness. Its got a lot going on, and it just isnt as tart as I was hoping it would be. The flavor is more of a traditional saison. Its very dusty and carries a lot of spice with the Belgian malt ant yeastiness. The mouth feel is a little thin, but carries some nice carbonation. Its just not the level of tart I was hoping for in a saison. I guess its more traditional, and not bad, but it could be a touch better.

Bottle: Poured a light bright blonde color ale with a huge pure white foamy head with excellent retention and some lacing. Aroma of tart notes with some white wine and light botanical notes is intriguing and somewhat unique. Taste is also a mix of gin and white wine with sharp tart notes and some floral undertones with an herbal-like finish. Body is slightly hazy with great carbonation. Tartness is maybe more harp then I would like but very enjoyable mix of flavours with tons of complexity.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 750 bottle from trade with Matt. Aroma: awesome complex nose of funky apricot, lemon, apples, spices, herbs and a tiny bit of gin. App: hazy golden with straw tints, small white head, great lacing. Had some gushing at opening but I was ready though but be careful. Taste and palate: thin to medium body, moderate high carbonation, kinda fruity in mouth, acidity and bitter dry finish. Overall: Pretty good. Complex, great refine taste of fruits. Loved the palate as well. A saison as I like them: funky, fruity and complex. This saison is has good as any HF saison. Something I could drink often.

Super dusty mineral nose with some light lemon soft grain herbal earthy notes. Golden orange pour creamy frothy head lace. Dry minerally lemon soft dry malt herbal pepper moderate fruity sweetness. Solid funky balance, dry finish. Nice carbonation dry herbal finish spicy almost. Really cool beer.

750ml bottle pours cloudy pale orange with big fluffy head. Nose is herbal bretty spice, orange and tangy citrus, dusty hay, greens and spice. Taste is nice light doughy grain, herbal green and orange spice, spruce and pine, citrus and soft wet melon. Finishes dry, vanilla, hay, grain, cantaloupe, pine spice, herb. Nice!

759 mL bottle poured and shared. Pours a cloudy peach golden color with an infinite amount of foam head. Sweet peach, apricot, and floral aroma with hints of the gin barrel. Flavor is the same orange fruit, brett background, and a dry, floral gin like finish. Cant say enough about this beer. Incredible stuff. Very flavorful. Delicious. Loved it.

Bottle, courtesy of a çhïłł br, shared in a location remote of my living room. 
Pours a hazy blonde with a good head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The atom is lemon and wet limestone. Its got some bright notes, but its also funky with some leafy hop character. Its got some barnyard, a bit of oak.... coooooool!

The flavor is more earthy than tart, but certainly both. Its dry with a nice level of bitterness, some light woody character... some herbal character and some floral notes. Its lightly fruity, and its just real chill.

I dig.

Pours pale, bit hazy, bit of foam. Aroma is just beautiful, really dryly fruity, lambic like. Just perfect. Taste is following the same vein, fruity, rather dry, just exact amount of carbonation. Really good. Perfect saison.

Thanks to ShoulderBroken for sharing the bottle!

Half the bottle foamed over so this is based on what was left.

Poured into a taster showing a finger of clean white foam and very cloudy deep yellow. 

The nose shows sweet and clean lemon drops. 

The palate is highly carbonated and light bodied. Very fruit forward showing peaches, apricot, and light citric fruits (oranges). Entwined with a light sweet malt throughout. Citrus and zest bitterness. Overall a fruit forward extremely well done saison.

Hazy chalk yellow. Juniper berry, wheat funk with a bit of pepper. Dry funky, pepper, juniper berry, so smooth and super balanced, quaffable. Amazingly approachable one of the best american saisons ever. Wow.

Bottle care of Al, pours murky golden with large white head. Vegetal and earthy funk. Nice brett profile with some Belgian fruit, grass, and light spice. and pepper. Well carbonated with a lot of balance. Mandarin orange aftertaste. Nice.
Bottle shared Marcus. Pours yellow with white head. Taste is malts with a slight Belgian yeast an hops.

Bottle from Final Gravity. Pours cloudy dirty blonde with a huge white head and an apricot and gin aroma. There is a herbaceous fruit flavor with a nice yeast presence and a lingering gin taste. Nicely constructed.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy, slightly dirty gold with a foamy off-white head. Aroma of citrus, berry, earth, stone fruit of the lighter sort, and gin!!! Med + body. Flavor has lots of citrus, fruit and juniper. Delicious.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of gin, herbs, white wine, oak, sour lemon and citrus funk - medium body.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Citrus, fruit, light tart aromas. Light wine, oak, fruit, tart tones.

Pours a medium golden orange color with two fingers of thick foam. Lots of nectarine, citrus peel, rustic grain. Nuances of wet oak, funky brett and layers of floral hay, soft fruit esters and a lingering hint of herbal nuances.
UPDATED: JUL 25, 2015 Bottle at the brewery. Aroma is amazing, apricot and Brett, grainy. Taste is good, smooth, creamy, yoghurt, little fruity sweetness. Very nice. Smooth.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy golden yellow with a fine white head. Light flowery aromas, a bit of gentle white pepper, spicy and lemon zesty. Light body, a bit sweet compared to the pungeant spiciness and peppery notes. Taste is lightly pale malt, and some pepper notes. a typical American version of the saision style.

Bottle to snifter. A lightly cloudy deep yellow to light orange color with a medium/low white head. Aroma is fruity, pithy, light woody aroma, some spiciness. Flavor is fruity up front, with some light pepper phenols mid palate. Finishes dry with the woody, quenching notes. I think I get some of the gin fruitiness as well, like a lime or whatever they put in gin. Overall, a hell of a quenching, fruit forward, but still true to style saison. This is great stuff.

Hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of gin barrel, apricots, earthy and citrusy grain... Flavor is light citrus and apricots, light notes of gin and pine on palate... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle share. Hazy light orange. Aroma of juniper, wood notes, citrus, wet attic, hay. Taste is sweet with a bit of tartness. Silky mouthfeel, and wonderfully clean.

Cloudy golden with a good creamy white head. Aroma is orange juice, gin, mint, apricot, juniper, wildflowers. Medium-full bodied, lightly creamy mouthfeel, fruity on the palate with a long dry lightly woody finish. Taste is white peach, orange peel, juniper, gooseberry.
25.4 oz bottle. Aroma: citrusy, with hints of lime and white wine. Taste/Palate: sour, tart, crisp, and slightly sweet.

5th Anniversary edition, aged a year, I was told. Poured from a bottle. Aroma is citrusy and tart. Flavor is slightly creamy and light in the front and orange, lime and spice (coriander?). Definitely finishes bitter and tart.

Bottle from Prufrockstar - thanks Chris! Hazy light orangish-amber pour with a nice white head. Awesome nose, citrus, botanicals, a hint of stone fruit. Awesome taste too. A ton going on. A touch of funk, some herbal gin stuff happening, a slight floral and citrus finish.

[ Bottle ][ 2oz ][ Tasting ][ ][ Champagne Flute ][ 12.07.14 ]murky gold, puffy white head, good lacing. Ultra high C-tang nose, husky grain with huge lactic presence, tons of citrus rind with flaked wheat. Front palate is slight white grape, husky and dirty mid, soapy esters, dry filmy finish, gritty palate is lightly dirty, citrus throughout but lacks integration.

Pours hazy gold with moderate head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of wet woody brett, creamy fruit, light citrus and butter. Flavors of apricot/peach skins, wheat, guava, and citrus. Tart, resin-y finish.
Good peppery vinegar aroma. Orange with some head and lace. Creamy mouthfeel.orange finish.

750ml bottle pours a hazy, straw gold with some very cloudy, white head. Nose has quite a bit of brett, dusty, flower pollen, lemon, chrysanthemum, tea, lemongrass. Flavor is sweet, mild candy, mild honey, a little cough drop, lots of lemon, some lemongrass too, a little coriander. Clean finish. Solid.

750ml bottle. Poured a hazy yellow orange color with a small off-white head. Aroma was light straw, lemon zest notes. Flavor had nice light citrus lemon notes, light yeast notes. Touch of lime finish.
Very nice. Citrus and lime. Pours hazy yellow with good head and lacing. Light tart finish. Good balance. Some florals. Bottle thanks to noodleuser.
From a bottle at the DC Ratebeer event Dec. 6, 2014. Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head. Lemon and cardamom aromas. Flavors of lemonaid and lysol. Bitter, tart finish.

On tap at Alibi Room in Vancouver. Lemony coloured pale fizzy head. Fruity sour nose. Mouth is tart fruity spicy. Not getting much if any barrel impression here. Nice but unseasonal for November. 3.4.

750ml bottle from CANBIF 2014...very thankful to try this as I have had some great experiences from upright and loved visiting the brewery! Vibrant hazy and pale orange with a creamy white head that settles to a nice mellow blanket on top of the beer. Without reading the description I wouldnt have been able to say juniper but there are definitely some fruity gin notes that overlay a bouquet of apple, white grapes, light oak, nice fresh but light tartness with some mild acidity and a bit of lemon pulp. Moderate+ carbonation, mild+ body, refreshing with a nice bitterness and some sweetness to cut the bite, nice dryness, bit of chardonnay and herbs along with some fruit notes on the finish. Tasty.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low-medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of lots of herbs. Taste is of saison yeast, spices, fruits, nice yeast. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice beer.

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks bro. pours hazy/cloudy pale yellow with a very ncie white head,, good retention and lacing. lots of spices and herbaceous notes - dill, flowers, juicy citrus, peppery and fragrant gin, berry fruitiness - tropical and pienapple notes as well, very lemony with just a part of its acidity, fragrant wood - white wine. bright to average carbonation, light body, oily, light acidity - pretty complex, drying and lightly tannic and tart finish. very tasty and very pleasant! much enjoyed!

Bottle shared at tasting. Hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is really citrusy, lemony, light white wine notes, really bright and fresh floral hop notes. Taste is citrusy, well hopped, lemony. Palate is light, dry, really easy drinking. Really enjoyable saison.

Pours a cloudy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of fruits, flowers and soap. The soap part is a bit sad but it isnt too distracting. Taste is dry and offers some nice spicy flavors, fresh and perfumey. It also carries some dill, not sure what can cause that though. Body was medium, same for carbonation. Overall a nice saison, maybe a bit subpar for an anniversary beer?

Bottle (750 ml). From Thomas, thanks! Slow gusher. Slightly hazy golden with a medium white head and some lacing. Aroma is herbal with light spiciness, perfume notes, citrus/sunlight and floral presence. Taste is also herbal and citrusy/sunlight with light acidic notes, white grapes and light spiciness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Almost creamy mouthfeel. Super tasty and quite drinkable. Barrel is present, but not overdone. Another good one from Upright.

Tasting sessions with my friend Frank. Beau corps doré qui sembrouille. Monstrueuse tête qui coule le long de mon verre. Une dentelle épaisse et bien large. Un nez discret de gingembre avec des herbes, des fruits jaunes et oranges et des effluves dune délicieuse campagne. Un goût épicé avec des plantes sauvages, du poivre citronné, des bretts, des ananas et des fruits du verger. Cest sec et cest excellent pour mes papilles. Une bouche bien remuée par les bulles. Une texture légèrement mousseuse. Une finale ravissante pour les amateurs de gin et pour les amateurs de fermières sauvages. Très bon. Je dirais même plus, très très bon.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is fairly fruity with some nice apricot character and honeydew and cantaloupe melon notes. Medium light citrus notes of lemon and lime. Some lemongrass and lemon verbena. Some light phenolic pepper notes. 
Pours a cloudy, pale golden orange with a fairly large, fluffy white head that displays average retention. Medium light lacing and medium legs. 
Flavor is slightly acidic with a medium citrus character of lime peel and some orange. Some medium light phenolic notes of coriander and some stronger herbal character. Light oak character with spirits notes. Faint malt notes. Light apricot notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium, creamy carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really enjoyable saison from Upright. Lots of fruit and barrel character with some soft malt and water notes. Everything is well balanced and enjoyable.
Floral, earthy, light tart and fruity aroma. Tart, earthy flavor; Pepper, floral. Fruity finish. Kind of a tannin mouthfeel.

750ml bottle thanks to Doug 
Cloudy straw yellow with a big white head and some lacing. Aroma is tart, barnyard and fruity. Taste is tart, sawdust, fruity, lemon peel with a dry finish  
Nice
Gold, hazy, off-white head. Aroma of grainy malt, lemons, light spice. Flavor is similar with a light acidity and tartness. Very nice.
Bottle, shared at RBAG 2014, I believe by Ferris. Murky/opaque yellow with a creamy white head. Unripened apricot, subtle funk, yoghurty lactic acidity, gentle wheat malt structure. Very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, picked up @ Metro in Victoria. Hazy yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Citrusy, bretty aroma. Slightly sour, funky taste, citrus. Nice, easy sipper.
Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is floral, funk, and oak. Medium mouthfeel with light dry fruit, oak, yeast, good.
Bottle - Stone fruit and some tart apricot with a funky finish. Cloudy orange with a decent white head. Dusty, yogurt and some stone fruit. And a funky finish. Pretty decent.

Bottle shared by Ferris at RBAG. Cloudy yellow pour with white frothy head. Aroma is Brett funk, lemon citrus, juicy fruit, and mild tartness. Taste is juicy tropical/citrus fruit up front, followed by some mild pepper, a bit of funk, dry finish. Really nice.

Bottle at Apex split with Eric. Pour is hazy yellow with a big white head and great lacing. Big brett, orange funk, lemon, biscuit, slightly funky, urine, medicinal, herbal, and grassy aroma. Taste is band-aid, medicinal, oaky, lemony, biscuit, lemon peel, lightly piney, mangos, pineapple, and oranges with a lightly tart and funky aroma. Medium body with high carbonation. Really nice bretted saison.

At APEX with Stephen and Dina. Pours bright neon orange; hazy with light lopsided lacing. Aroma is big Brett bomb, floral zesty orange peel, hint of musk way in the background, fruity. Taste is bretty, more funky musk forward, dry, fruit is not there, Brett is a little overpowering and not balanced with other funky notes, but still a great beer.

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy gold with moderate head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of wet woody brett, creamy fruit, light citrus and butter. Flavors of apricot/peach skins, wheat, guava, and citrus. Tart, resin-y finish. Great stuff.

750 ml bottle shared by pantanap. Thanks, buddy. Pours a well hazed golden orange hue, fluffy and creamy with nice cakey whitish head atop. A nice layer sticks around and laces well. Fluffy ring atop laces well and sticks around. Aromas are vibrant tartness, lemon and white grape meet earth, gentle florals and yeastiness. Some bready malts, gentle gin and botalical, touches of juniper, gentle oak and vanillin. Initial is lighter end of the fold, some creamy body, some gentle citrusy lemon tartness, florals and. Bit of bready malt. Bread dough, touches of botanicals, mellow oak. Nice fruit elements, tart green apple, some touches of pear and mellow fruity esters. Middle is a touch sweeter, some sweet tarts, gentle straw, cereal malts and gentle yogurty softness and tartness hitting at times. Backend is a bit tart, gentle bitterness with touches of florals, gentle oak and mellow lingering yeast. A nice sour/tart jab, yogurty backend shows some dry and bitter qualities as we finish up. Nice, potent bright nose with a really welll done. Nice stuff.

Lasting frothy white head atop a clouded pineapple juice colour. Nose of ginger, yeasty. Flavour is highly solvent, lime sherbet, ginger shavings, Seville oranges. Very flavourful. One of my upright favourites. Purchased at Metro Liquor University Heights.

Bottle from Belmont Station

A: Cloudy orange with a fluffy white head. 

N: Pine, esters, apricot, lemon rind, black peppercorn, gin shines through the base with a sweet minty conifer. Some funk, horse blanket, and straw.

T: Quite tart and a stringent bitterness.

M: Creamy, well carbonated, a bit sticky on the palate. 

O: Very complex. Similar in nature to the Belmont Station 14th Anniversary, but the apricot clashes a bit with the mint in this one.

Bottle thanks to Tommy. It pours cloudy golden-orange with a medium white head. The nose is fresh, brett, barnyard, orange peel, Irn Bru, sherbet, wood and gin. The taste is crisp, tart orange, tangerines, sherbet, vinous, alcohol kick, wood, earth, barnyard, sherbet, gin aspect, pepper hit with a dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Good depth to it. Fruity and very drinkable.

Bottle from The Bier Stein, Eugene. Pours a golden orange, decent amoun of off white head. Aroma full and fluffy, some floral notes, hints of gin, a lacto tang and just a wee bit of wood. A lot going on, but all elements are distinct in the way the best saisons can be. Body lively and slight, finish surprisingly bitter, with a grapefruit crispness. Nicely done.

750ml bottle, shared with my wife. Pours hazy gold with white head. Aroma is downright pleasant. Juniper berries / gin play a prominent role, blending with citrus fruit, peppercorns, lemon zest, and a bit of funk for good measure. Taste: well thats downright pleasant as well. Dry; mineral; great interplay between the gin barrel and the base. Wine barrels subtly add to the mix as well, I imagine, but I wouldnt pick it out unless I was stretching for additional descriptors. Pleasant finish. Light-medium body, bring carbonation. Overall: one of my favorite releases from Upright so far. Im glad to hear this will be released annually, because Id love to have more. Props for being the first gin barrel aged beer that feels complete in itself. With gin barrel beers, I usually end up wishing Id just had a gin&tonic, but I could see drinking a gin&tonic and wishing it was this instead.

Bottle at Baileys. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a dense and sudsy white head that sticks around pretty much forever. Nice big tangy citric and estery nose, great marriage of fruity hop and yeast notes with minimal pepperiness. Creamy medium body with lively carb. The citric and estery qualities are joined by some light mineral notes and tiny hints of funk on the mid palate. Long dry finish. Wonderful beer. Every day should be an anniversary.

Bottle... Poured hazy, golden yellowish with a moderate head. Aroma of mild yeast funk, herbal earthy tones, and apricots. A hint of brett and farmhouse funk here with an earthy, musky tone. No sourness which allowed the yeast spices to shine. Mild oak and barrel notes with a hint of stone fruit. The apricots seemed more evident on the nose but thats ok. Damn fine tasting Upright beer.

Smells like sulphury, musty apricots, apricot skin too. Hazy, burnt orange, off white. Big mineral notes, apricots, minty and herbal notes from the gin, musty and footy but in a good way. Such an interesting, bold saison. Big thick body, that sticks to the glass. Upright continues to surprise every time.

750ml bottle Pours a murky golden with a lasting white head. This is the third time Ive had this beer and the main component that sticks with me is its rustic, almost ballsy strong funk mineral driven flavor. Big fruit, musty gin barrel comes through, pepper and sulfur, rich texture. Very intriguing, Im curious to some age.

On tap at Upright, pours a cloudy pale golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out amazingly complex citrus notes, Belgian yeast, farmhouse notes, and bready notes. Flavour is stunningly complex, with amazing farmhouse notes, Belgian yeast, light spices, and dry bready notes. Wonderful complexity here, with a dry, lightly spicy body, with no residual sugars. Fantastic.

On tap at the brewery. Happy Anniversary! What a great event. Anyway, this beer is just awesome. Pours a golden hue with a large fluffy white head. The aroma is massive barnyard grains/hay, lemons, fresh shot of gin, deep brett cobwebs. The flavor is intense, but the dominant description I;d add is drinkable. Fresh oranges, pine, floral, a bit of oak, vinous light notes, gin barrel, very soft fluffy palate, intense brett pulling in straw and citrus, light zesty tartness. Awesome beer.
